intro: Pelargonium glabriphyllum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved geranium, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are smooth to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and ease of care, it is widely cultivated in gardens around the world.
